column2: CALIFORNIA DMV WRITTEN TEST
column4: California
column6: CA

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. Your BAC depends on:
column4: how much time passes between drinks.
column6: how much alcohol you drink.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 2. This sign indicates:
column4: Divided highway ends
column6: Merging traffic
column8: Winding road

column2: 3. On a freeway, drivers should look farther ahead than they normally would on a city street:
column4: because it takes 500 feet to stop a vehicle on a freeway.
column6: in order to spot potential hazards and dangers ahead.
column8: because there are multiple lanes.

column2: 4. If your car goes into water, you should:
column4: wait for water to rush in and let it out in small breaths through your nose.
column6: call the fire department immediately.
column8: remove yourself before it starts to sink.

column2: 5. Who is most at risk?
column4: Drivers who are fatigued.
column6: Drivers who are driving on long, boring roads.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 6. A driver cuts off another vehicle, or threatens another motorist or a pedestrian. These are examples of:
column4: excessive driving
column6: defensive driving
column8: road rage

column2: 7. This regulatory road sign indicates that:
column4: The right hand lane is reserved for buses and car-pool vehicles.
column6: Vehicles must slow down and stay in the right lane.
column8: Slower vehicles traveling on multiple lane highways must stay in the right hand lane.

column2: 8. The ‘One Way’ sign means that:
column4: there is only one road that turns left at the intersection.
column6: drivers may travel only in the direction of the arrow.
column8: only vehicles turning left may travel in the direction of the arrow.

column2: 9. Driving slowly in front of traffic in the far left (last) lane on any freeway:
column4: cannot result in a traffic citation.
column6: saves lives by causing others to slow down, too.
column8: can frustrate other drivers and make them angry.

column2: 10. You are approaching an intersection. The traffic signal light is flashing red. What should you do?
column4: Cautiously continue driving through the intersection.
column6: Stop before entering. Wait for the green light before proceeding.
column8: Stop before entering, then proceed when safe.

column2: 11. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: there is a double curve ahead.
column6: there is a winding road ahead.
column8: the highway ahead is divided into two one-way roadways. Drivers should keep to the right.

column2: 12. Tailgating:
column4: is a defensive driving tecnique.
column6: cannot result in a traffic citation.
column8: can frustrate other drivers and make them angry.

column2: 13. At a stop sign there is no stop line or crosswalk. You must stop:
column4: before you enter the intersection.
column6: after you enter the intersection, if you have a clear view of traffic on the intersecting roadway.
column8: at the next crosswalk.

column2: 14. You want to pass a bicyclist riding on the right edge of your lane. You:
column4: must not squeeze past the bicyclist.
column6: may not pass the bicyclist for any reason.
column8: must honk your horn before passing the bicyclist.

column2: 15. Parking is never permitted:
column4: in a crosshatched (diagonal) pattern space.
column6: in a bicycle lane, unless otherwise posted.
column8: twenty feet from a railroad track.

column2: 16. This sign means:
column4: the right lane will end ahead.
column6: the highway will be divided ahead.
column8: less space between lanes ahead.

column2: 17. You may not park your vehicle:
column4: On the side of the freeway in an emergency.
column6: Within 100 feet of an elementary school.
column8: Next to a red painted curb.

column2: 18. ABS is the acronym for:
column4: Anti-Locking Brake System
column6: Anti-Braking System
column8: Average-Beam System

column2: 19. You should not pass another vehicle:
column4: on a multi-lane one-way street.
column6: where someone is likely to enter or cross the road.
column8: when a broken, yellow line is on the left side of your lane.

column2: 20. Which shape is a railroad advance warning sign?
column4: Pentagon
column6: Round
column8: Crossbuck

column2: 21. What is the main reason night driving is more difficult than daytime driving?
column4: The use of headlight is required by law.
column6: Driving within the range.
column8: Reduced visibility.

column2: 22. This sign means:
column4: U-turns not allowed.
column6: Stop sign ahead.
column8: Do not enter a road or off ramp where the sign is posted.

column2: 23. This warning sign:
column4: indicates the suggested highest safe speed.
column6: provides advance notice to upcoming speed limit change.
column8: shows the current speed limit that all vehicles traveling in the direction of the arrow must not exceed.

column2: 24. You see a vehicle approaching from the rear. When you check your mirror again to change lanes, you no longer see the vehicle. You should:
column4: turn your signal on and change lanes slowly.
column6: look over your shoulder to be sure the vehicle isn’t in your blind spot.
column8: check your outside mirror to see if the vehicle is in your blind spot.

column2: 25. You are involved in a minor collision at an intersection. There are no injuries and very little vehicle damage. You should:
column4: Leave your vehicle in the traffic lane until law enforcement arrives.
column6: Move your vehicle out of the traffic lane, if possible.
column8: Not move your vehicle for any reasons.

column2: 26. If you are leaving a parking lot, you:
column4: must turn either left or right only when it is safe.
column6: have the right-of-way.
column8: must yield to traffic before re-entering the road.

column2: 27. If you have a green light, but traffic is blocking the intersection, you should:
column4: enter the intersection and wait until traffic clears.
column6: merge into another lane and try to go around the traffic.
column8: stay out of the intersection until traffic clears.

column2: 28. When parking your vehicle on any hill:
column4: your front wheels should be parallel to the road if there is no curb.
column6: use your parking brake and leave the vehicle in gear or “park”.
column8: one of your rear wheels should touch the curb.

column2: 29. Regulatory signs are:
column4: Suggestions
column6: Law
column8: Warnings

column2: 30. Your BAC depends on:
column4: the amount of alcohol you drink.
column6: the type of beverage you drink.
column8: how fit you are.

column2: 31. U-turns in business districts are:
column4: legal whenever oncoming vehicles are not a hazard.
column6: legal only at intersections, unless a sign prohibits them.
column8: always illegal.

column2: 32. What should you do as you prepare to turn right at an intersection?
column4: Signal your turn, check for bicyclists, and do not turn directly in front of a bicyclist.
column6: Yield to bicyclists coming from the opposite direction.
column8: Honk your horn.

column2: 33. What is the maximum speed limit on two-lane undivided highways, unless otherwise posted?
column4: 45 MPH
column6: 65 MPH
column8: 55 MPH

column2: 34. When parking next to a curb, you should use your turn signals:
column4: when pulling next to or away from the curb.
column6: when pulling next to, but not away from the curb.
column8: only when pulling away from the curb.

column2: 35. When the road is slippery, you should:
column4: pump your brakes.
column6: brake suddenly carefully.
column8: press your brakes in slow, steady strokes.

column2: 36. A vehicle that enters a road from a driveway:
column4: has the right-of-way.
column6: must stop and yield the right-of-way to traffic on the roadway and to pedestrians.
column8: must yield to traffic approaching from the right, while it has the right-of-way over vehicles approaching from the left.
